title: The Best Split Pea Soup
shortDescription: A classic split pea soup, perfected over time. Truly, it is a failure-proof recipe.
description: Learn how to make a restaurant-quality Margherita pizza at home. With a crispy crust, tangy tomato sauce, and fresh mozzarella, this pizza is a crowd-pleaser!
directions: In a large bowl, mix flour, salt, and yeast. Add warm water and olive oil, then mix until a dough forms.
Turn the dough onto a floured surface and knead for about 5 minutes until smooth and elastic.
Place the dough in an oiled bowl, cover with plastic wrap, and let rise for about 1-2 hours, or until doubled in size.
Preheat your oven to the highest temperature (usually 500°F/260°C) with a pizza stone or baking sheet inside.
Divide the dough into two equal parts. On a floured surface, stretch or roll each piece into a round shape.
Spread tomato sauce over the dough, leaving a small border for the crust.
Add sliced mozzarella evenly on top.
Carefully transfer the pizza to the preheated pizza stone or baking sheet.
Bake for 10-12 minutes, or until the crust is golden and the cheese is bubbly.
Remove from the oven, top with fresh basil leaves, drizzle with olive oil, and season with salt and pepper.
Allow to cool slightly before slicing and serving.
